TopicTitle: Most attractive celestial body from low orbit?

Articles.Content:
I have sent probes and established satellites in the Joolian system, I've been to Moho, I have sent manned missions to Gilly and Duna and sent unmanned probes to Eve but I believe nothing matches the varied high albedo mountain ranges and Ice flats of Minmus.

What do you guys think?
I agree, Minmus is awesome, but I still prefer Duna myself.

Of the places I've been, MÃƒÂ¼n (I'm horribly biased). In close second, Dres. Third it's even between Duna, Laythe and Eve.

Just looking around in the tracking station though, the colour combinations of Pol look very interesting.
Duna. I've always loved Mars.

I have sent probes to laythe before but just yesterday I sent a manned mission to Laythe and safely landed, set up a flag and enjoyed the view I had on the coast. Amazingly beautiful planet Laythe is.
There's something eerily beautiful about it.
First Tylo, then Dres.

I have sent probes to laythe before but just yesterday I sent a manned mission to Laythe and safely landed, set up a flag and enjoyed the view I had on the coast. Amazingly beautiful planet Laythe is.

Lathe has some views. Looking over a sand dune, across the sea and into the depths of the Green Jool is amazing. Especially if a few other moons dot the sky too...
I'm kinda fond of Duna:
Am I the only one who really loves Vall?
This thing about sunrises. I like them.

I do think Laythe is a little overrated, but I like it too.

But what takes the cake for me is Vall.

It's like if you combined the awesomeness of Minmus and the Mun.
Frikkin' Jool.
I love Duna by itself. Mostly because it looks like I'm really on Mars. If you include the celestial scenery, I suppose it's hard to beat Laythe or Vall.
It would be Duna for me. It reminds me of Mars and all the mythology involved and what humans believed about the red planet. It's kinda magical in a sciency way.
The new Mun craters may change a lot of minds
The answer to any "what's the prettiest" type of question is always Vall. (I'm sorry if some of you are sick of these screenshots that I have posted many times.)

The new Mun craters may change a lot of minds

Unless they generalize it and give similar (or totally different and unique) terrain modifications to all planets.

Unless they generalize it and give similar (or totally different and unique) terrain modifications to all planets.

They'll only be applied to the Mun in the next update.
Drifting over Bop with Jool, Laythe, Vall and Tylo hovering in the sky is as good as it's got so far. I'll withhold a full opinion till all the celestial bodies are in the game

The new Mun craters may change a lot of minds

Are there any pics yet? I'm totally excited to revisit the Mun.

Most attractive celestial body? Me.

Oh that's not what you meant, I'll have to vote for Eve, just cuz I like the color.

Personally, I like Duna. It's very pretty. Here are some reasons why I picked Duna, and didn't pick the others:

-Duna has an atmosphere which automatically helps it look pretty.

-Kerbin is inherently pretty but I see it so much it's almost mundane.

-The Sun is far too bright to notice any real features when orbiting closely.

-All the rocky planets seem very desolate and lonely, except Vall for some reason...

-Laythe looks too much like Kerbin to me.

-Jool is so.. Freaking... Green...

-Eve, while pretty, makes me slightly somber. It looks so lonely.. So untouched and misunderstood..

Duna is best planet.
Either vall or eve. Eve as the sunrises, my god frocks and that banjo they are glorious, and vall has some beautiful scenery.
